comments.text:
If the user disables or disables and then re-enables or installs/re-installs the extension while the Dashboard is already opened in a tab, they cannot launch an app by clicking on it. If you click on the app icon, it will act as though you are scrolling and follow your mouse. The user must refresh the Dashboard or re-launch the Dashboard to fix the problem.

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Launch Firefox
2. Install the apps extension - Can be found at http://people.mozilla.com/~dclarke/openwebapps/Extension/ and look for openwebapps-6b34ccec35-11_21_2011.xpi
3. Go to apps.mozillalabs.com/appdir and install an app
4. GO to myapps.mozillalabs.com to launch the Dashboard
5. Disable the apps extension (use another tab and keep the Dashboard opened) - Tools>Add-ons>Extensions
6. Go back to the tab with the Dashboard and try to launch an app by clicking on it

Alternate Steps:
For step 5, disable the extension but then also enable it

Alternate Steps:
For step 5, just re-install the extension

Actual Results:
App does not open and if you move the mouse, the Dashboard will be scrolled. The mouse will get 'attached' to the app icon.

Expected Results:
Clicking on the app should launch it in an app tab. The user should not have to refresh the Dashboard.
